alert.note: Alert for Arlington; Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 4:32PM EDT until June 02 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY...CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES...NORTH CENTRAL ARLINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN FAIRFAX COUNTIES... At 431 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Fort Totten, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management reported multiple instances of wind damage in southeast Montgomery County. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Bethesda, Bowie, College Park, Greenbelt, Langley Park, Forestville, Largo, Coral Hills, Bladensburg, Upper Marlboro, University of Maryland, Fedex Field, Howard University, Gallaudet University, Fort Totten, RFK Stadium, Landover, Hyattsville and Takoma Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
